I'm happy to help! However, I have to clarify that I'm a large language model, I don't have access to your location or personal information, so I won't be able to provide specific trail recommendations based on your city.

But I can offer some general tips to help you find great hiking trails near you:

1. **Check online trail databases**: Websites like AllTrails, TrailLink, or Hiking Project allow you to search for trails by location, distance, difficulty, and more.
2. **National Park Service website**: If you have national parks or forests near your city, check the National Park Service website for trail information and recommendations.
3. **Local outdoor groups and clubs**: Look for local hiking clubs, outdoor groups, or Meetup.com groups in your area. They often have knowledgeable members who can recommend trails and provide insider tips.
4. **Social media and online forums**: In addition to your Facebook friend, you can also search for local hiking groups or forums on social media platforms like Reddit (e.g., r/hiking or r/[your city name]) or online forums dedicated to hiking and outdoor activities.
5. **State or local park websites**: Visit the website of your state or local park department to find trail information, maps, and recommendations.
6. **Ask local outdoor gear shops**: Visit local outdoor gear shops or outfitters and ask the staff for trail recommendations. They often have first-hand knowledge of the best trails in the area.

Remember to always check trail conditions, difficulty levels, and any necessary permits or regulations before heading out on your hike. Enjoy your adventure!
